location.zh-cn: 中华民国台北市士林区阳明山
location.en: Yangmingshan, Shilin District, Taipei City, Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 位于台湾台北市士林区阳明山的一所私立综合大学，由张其昀于1962年创办。其校舍以中国宫殿式建筑风格为特色。
description.en: A private comprehensive university located on Yangmingshan in Shilin District, Taipei, Taiwan, founded in 1962 by Chang Chi-yun. Its campus is known for its traditional Chinese palace-style architecture.

description.zh-cn: 中国史地学家及教育家，中国文化大学的创办人。曾任中华民国教育部部长，是现代儒学和中国文化复兴运动的先驱之一。
description.en: A Chinese historian, geographer, and educator, founder of Chinese Culture University. He served as the Minister of Education of the Republic of China and was a pioneer of the modern Confucianism and Chinese cultural renaissance movement.

description.zh-cn: 时任中华民国总统。1962年，他建议将中国文化大学的原拟校名“远东大学”更改为“中国文化学院”。
description.en: Then-President of the Republic of China. In 1962, he suggested changing the originally proposed name of the university from 'Far East University' to 'Chinese Culture College'.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国的教育事务主管机关。1980年核准中国文化学院升格改制为中国文化大学。
description.en: The competent authority for educational affairs in the Republic of China. It approved the upgrade of Chinese Culture College to Chinese Culture University in 1980.

description.zh-cn: 建筑师，负责中国文化大学的校园建设规划，设计了包括大成馆、大仁馆、大义馆、大典馆在内的多座中国宫殿式建筑。
description.en: An architect responsible for the campus construction planning of Chinese Culture University, who designed several Chinese palace-style buildings including Dacheng Hall, Daren Hall, Dayi Hall, and Dadian Hall.

description.zh-cn: 台湾的一所国立大学。中国文化大学创办人张其昀曾在此任教。
description.en: A national university in Taiwan where Chang Chi-yun, the founder of Chinese Culture University, once taught.

description.zh-cn: 中国文化大学的第二任董事长。
description.en: The second Chairman of the Board of Trustees of Chinese Culture University.

description.zh-cn: 中国文化大学现任董事长，曾任国立台湾大学学术副校长。
description.en: The current Chairman of the Board of Trustees of Chinese Culture University, formerly the Academic Vice President of National Taiwan University.

description.zh-cn: 中国文化大学现任校长。
description.en: The current President of Chinese Culture University.

description.zh-cn: 前中华民国教育部部长，现任中国文化大学董事。
description.en: Former Minister of Education of the Republic of China and a current member of the Board of Trustees of Chinese Culture University.

description.zh-cn: 中国文化大学前校长及现任董事。
description.en: Former President and current member of the Board of Trustees of Chinese Culture University.

description.zh-cn: 台湾的人寿保险公司，长期赞助中国文化大学女子篮球队，使其成为国泰人寿女子篮球队的幼队体系。
description.en: A life insurance company in Taiwan that has long sponsored the women's basketball team of Chinese Culture University, making it a youth team system for the Cathay Life Women's Basketball Team.

description.zh-cn: 台湾的一所私立大学。其女子篮球队在107学年度UBA联赛中击败中国文化大学，中止了后者的连霸纪录，两校在篮球领域存在竞争关系。
description.en: A private university in Taiwan. Its women's basketball team defeated Chinese Culture University in the 107th academic year UBA league, ending the latter's championship streak, indicating a competitive relationship between the two universities in basketball.

nodes.id: 台北市私立华冈艺术学校

zh-cn: 台北市私立华冈艺术学校

description.zh-cn: 一所位于台北市的纯艺术技术型高中，为中国文化大学“华冈学园”的组成部分之一。
description.en: A technical high school for the fine arts located in Taipei, which is part of the 'Hwa Kang School Garden' of Chinese Culture University.

description.zh-cn: 一个学术研究机构，与中国文化大学、华冈学会、华冈兴业基金会合称为“华冈学园”。
description.en: An academic research institution which, together with Chinese Culture University, the Hwa Kang Society, and the Hwa Kang Enterprise Foundation, is collectively known as the 'Hwa Kang School Garden'.

description.zh-cn: 由张其昀于1972年创设的基金会，旨在以学术推动实业，以兴业奖助兴学。与中国文化大学、华冈学会、中华学术院合称为“华冈学园”。
description.en: A foundation established by Chang Chi-yun in 1972, aiming to promote industry through academia and support education through enterprise. It is collectively known as the 'Hwa Kang School Garden' along with Chinese Culture University, the Hwa Kang Society, and the Chung-Hwa Academy.

description.zh-cn: 中国文化大学所在的国家。
description.en: The country where Chinese Culture University is located.

description.zh-cn: 东亚的岛屿，中国文化大学所在地。
description.en: An island in East Asia, location of Chinese Culture University.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国的首都，中国文化大学校本部所在地。
description.en: The capital of the Republic of China, where the main campus of Chinese Culture University is located.

description.zh-cn: 台北市的一个市辖区，中国文化大学校本部所在地。
description.en: A district in Taipei City, where the main campus of Chinese Culture University is located.

description.zh-cn: 位于台北市的一座山，中国文化大学校本部所在地。
description.en: A mountain in Taipei City, where the main campus of Chinese Culture University is located.

description.zh-cn: 张其昀是中国文化大学的创办人。
description.en: Chang Chi-yun is the founder of Chinese Culture University.

description.zh-cn: 时任总统蒋中正致函建议将学校原拟校名“远东大学”更名为“中国文化学院”，此建议被创办人张其昀采纳。
description.en: Then-President Chiang Kai-shek sent a letter suggesting that the university's proposed name 'Far East University' be changed to 'Chinese Culture College', a suggestion that was adopted by founder Chang Chi-yun.

description.zh-cn: 张其昀曾担任中华民国教育部部长。
description.en: Chang Chi-yun served as the Minister of Education of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 张其昀曾在国立中央大学任教。
description.en: Chang Chi-yun once taught at National Central University.

description.zh-cn: 卢毓骏教授负责中国文化大学的校园建设规划，将华冈学园打造成中国建筑的博物馆，其设计深刻影响了校园的建筑风格和特色。
description.en: Professor Lu Yu-jun was responsible for the campus construction planning of Chinese Culture University, shaping the Hwa Kang campus into a museum of Chinese architecture. His designs profoundly influenced the campus's architectural style and characteristics.

description.zh-cn: 张其昀担任中国文化大学创校至1984年的董事长。
description.en: Chang Chi-yun served as the Chairman of the Board of Chinese Culture University from its founding until 1984.

description.zh-cn: 张镜湖自1984年至2019年担任中国文化大学董事长。
description.en: Chang Ching-hu served as the Chairman of the Board of Chinese Culture University from 1984 to 2019.

description.zh-cn: 陈泰然自2022年起担任中国文化大学董事长。
description.en: Chen Tai-ran has been serving as the Chairman of the Board of Chinese Culture University since 2022.

description.zh-cn: 王子奇自2022年起担任中国文化大学校长。
description.en: Wang Tzu-chi has been serving as the President of Chinese Culture University since 2022.

description.zh-cn: 吴清基为中国文化大学第19届董事会成员。
description.en: Wu Ching-ji is a member of the 19th Board of Trustees of Chinese Culture University.

description.zh-cn: 徐兴庆曾于2018至2021年间担任中国文化大学校长。
description.en: Hsu Hsing-ching served as the President of Chinese Culture University from 2018 to 2021.

description.zh-cn: 徐兴庆为中国文化大学第19届董事会成员。
description.en: Hsu Hsing-ching is a member of the 19th Board of Trustees of Chinese Culture University.

description.zh-cn: 国泰人寿赞助中国文化大学女子篮球队，使其成为国泰人寿女篮的幼队体系，促进了其发展。
description.en: Cathay Life Insurance sponsors the women's basketball team of Chinese Culture University, making it a youth team system for the Cathay Life Women's Basketball Team and promoting its development.

description.zh-cn: 在107学年度UBA公开女一级6晋4决赛中，中国文化大学败给世新大学，中止了连霸纪录，两校在女子篮球项目上形成竞争关系。
description.en: In the UBA Women's Open Division 1 quarter-finals of the 107th academic year, Chinese Culture University was defeated by Shih Hsin University, ending its championship streak. The two universities have a rivalry in women's basketball.

relationships.source: 台北市私立华冈艺术学校

description.zh-cn: 华冈艺术学校是中国文化大学“华冈学园”的组成部分，是其附属的教育机构。
description.en: Hwa Kang Arts School is part of the 'Hwa Kang School Garden' of Chinese Culture University and is its affiliated educational institution.

description.zh-cn: 张其昀于1972年3月21日创设了华冈兴业基金会。
description.en: Chang Chi-yun founded the Hwa Kang Enterprise Foundation on March 21, 1972.

description.zh-cn: 中国文化大学与中华学术院等机构合称为“华冈学园”，共同致力于文化与学术发展。
description.en: Chinese Culture University and Chung-Hwa Academy, along with other institutions, are collectively known as the 'Hwa Kang School Garden', jointly dedicated to cultural and academic development.

description.zh-cn: 中国文化大学与华冈兴业基金会等机构合称为“华冈学园”，后者旨在以兴业奖助兴学，支持学校发展。
description.en: Chinese Culture University and the Hwa Kang Enterprise Foundation, along with other institutions, are collectively known as the 'Hwa Kang School Garden'. The foundation aims to support the university's development by funding education through enterprise.
